Text.Value: Leave.
An unbeknownst command by fools that would intrude.

EditorData.NodeContext: The automaton has received an unknown command - he's still in protect mode, so he's getting ready to kill the intruder who gave a wrong command.

Text.Value: Come out of love for me, not love for blood and steel...

EditorData.NodeContext: He bows, then waits, head stil bowed. Beat while still bowed, then looks at you expectantly. He straightens back up, not really knowing what to do.

Text.Value: Of course, my love. Don't be afraid, sweet girl.
You're strong. You're stronger than you ever knew.
Out of my way. I'm not interested in riddles.

EditorData.stateContext: Softer voice, not quite reciting, but more talking to a lover. Can have a more natural flow.

Text.Value: Remember. I am always here for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: He was still holding an imaginary person's hands. Now, he releases them and caresses her face,

Text.Value: *Long hours spent studying at your college come back to you - this is the opening stanza of an old play, 'The Roads to Darkness'.*
*The automaton stands lifeless before you, gears silent, head low and heavy.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton's head is hanging down, but it's still standing otherwise.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Automaton is deactivated by antimagic field

Text.Value: As I already am.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton releases the player from the hug (normal size players only)
EditorData.NodeContext: The automaton released the player from the hug, and is looking at them. He's very sincerely saying he's proud of them.

Text.Value: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

Text.Value: My fault, my fault - I've nothing left to give.

EditorData.NodeContext: The robot is silent and pats his thighs, as if trying to find out if his pockets are empty, then bows several times, flustered. pause while patting down pockets

Text.Value: 'These empty sheets are all that's left of you. / The last of all the thoughtless gifts you gave.'
Yes, please.
What can I do? Say, would you like a hug?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton takes the player's hands in his. (only for normal height players)
EditorData.NodeContext: A bit of a pause before "Say, do you want a hug.

Text.Value: An unbeknownst command that I cannot fulfil.
Remember. I am always here for you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton releases the player's hands and caresses the player's cheek.

Text.Value: As I already am.

EditorData.NodeContext: He was hugging the air, as if he was hugging a person, and now lets go, looking the imaginary person in the eye. Voice should be soft and sincere.

Text.Value: Remember: you are loved, Lenore. So much.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton is hugging the player and whispering into their ear. (normal size players only)
EditorData.NodeContext: He's hugging the player and whispering into their ear.

Text.Value: Now steel shall ring: false tongue will speak no more!

EditorData.NodeContext: The automaton has received an unknown command - he's still in protect mode, so he's getting ready to kill the intruder who gave a wrong command.

Text.Value: Yes, please.
Come here. For just a moment. Let it out.

EditorData.NodeContext:
He was holding the air in his hands. Now, he starts to hug the air, as if he's hugging a person who isn't there.
Voice: he's talking more slowly and more natural. A small pause before let it out.

Text.Value: New sounds through damp and dark oppression break / Is it the foe, that foul, contemptuous heel?

EditorData.NodeContext: He delivers his lines, then waits expectantly.

Text.Value: I will hold onto them; it's all that I can do. / I can't throw them away; I've never been that brave.

EditorData.logicalname: Doesn't have an item to give.

Text.Value: What is this place?
I'm not foul or contemptuous, but I am a foe.
*You know these words - they are from the opening stanza of a play you found in this very tower.*
'The silence stretches on - I'm all alone. / Please, can I hold your hands, for just a while?'
Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Note for animator : Don't know how the mocap will work for the automaton so I put as silver for now but you can remove it if bowing, turning away will work with mocap.

Text.Value: 'Or art thou friend, a rescue from my lonely wake?'
And you will never walk this path alone.
'How can I trust? How will I ever know? / How can I show myself, my darkest me?'
*His arms are too tight and too low for a comfortable hug - as if he's meant to be embracing someone slightly shorter.*

EditorData.NodeContext: The automaton is hugging you firmly.

Text.Value: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.

EditorData.NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Text.Value: Attack it while it waits for an answer.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton gives the player a gift offscreen (still unknown what the gift is, probably something small, like  a potion.

Text.Value: And in its wake, it tramples everything. / We'll kill the rest, so that the one can thrive.

EditorData.NodeContext: After delivering the line, the robot salutes.

Text.Value: I'm a friend. I come in peace.
Remember: you are loved, Lenore. So much.

EditorData.NodeContext: He's hugging the air, as if he's hugging a person and whispering in her ear.

Text.Value: 'There is a light in every living thing. / It's crawling t'wards the surface to survive.'
If you do not your deepest secrets show? / Reveal your truth, give what you wish to see.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Note for animator : Don't know how the mocap will work for the automaton so I put silver for now but you can remove it if bowing, turning away will work with mocap.
EditorData.NodeContext: The automaton repeats the lines, then bows and turns away.

Text.Value: You're doing great. And everyone will be / so proud of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: He's hugging the air, as if he's hugging a person and whispering in her ear.

Text.Value: You're strong. You're stronger than you ever knew.

EditorData.NodeContext: He's still holding an imaginary person's hands.

Text.Value: What can I do? Say, would you like a hug?

EditorData.NodeContext: He's holding the air in his hands, as if he's holding two hands in his. A bit of a pause before "Say, do you want a hug.

Text.Value: Come here. For just a moment. Let it out.

EditorData.AnimationTags: (Amelie) Releases the hands and open his arms for the hug.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton takes the player into a hug (only players of normal height)
EditorData.NodeContext: he's talking more slowly and more natural. A small pause before let it out.

Text.Value: *His hands close around the air next to your face, as if he's taking the hands of someone taller.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: He grabs the air with both hands, as if he's grabbing someone's hands.

Text.Value: And you will never walk this path alone.
Who are you?
No, thanks.
I'm fine. Thanks.
You're doing great. And everyone will be / so proud of you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The automaton is hugging the player and is whispering into their ear. (normal size players only)
EditorData.NodeContext: He's hugging the player and whispering into their ear.

Synopsis:
This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.

Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
